definitions: a person or animal who is asleep or who sleeps in a specified way

examples.text: he was a light sleeper, for long periods an insomniac

shortDefinitions: person or animal who is asleep or who sleeps in specified way

definitions: a sleeping car, or a berth in one.
shortDefinitions: sleeping car, or berth in one

definitions: one-piece coverall pajamas for a baby or small child.
shortDefinitions: sleepsuit for baby or small child

definitions: a sofa or chair that converts into a bed.
shortDefinitions: sofa or chair that converts into bed

definitions: a movie, book, play, etc., that achieves sudden unexpected success after initially attracting little attention, typically one that proves popular without much promotion or expenditure

examples.text: this low-budget, black-and-white American sleeper concerns two brothers
it became one of the sleeper hits of the year

shortDefinitions: film, book, play, etc. that eventually achieves unexpected success after initially attracting very little attention

definitions: an antique whose true value goes unrecognized for some time

examples.text: photographed after it proved to be a sleeper, this Regency table took $8,600 instead of $1,500 as anticipated

shortDefinitions: antique whose true value goes unrecognized for some time

definitions: a secret agent who remains inactive for a long period while establishing a secure position

examples.text: a KGB plot to uncover his sleepers

shortDefinitions: secret agent who remains inactive for long period while establishing secure position
wooden or concrete beam laid transversely under railway track

definitions: a stocky fish with mottled coloration which occurs widely in warm seas and fresh water.

notes.text: Dormitator and other genera, family Gobiidae (or Eleotridae): many species

shortDefinitions: stocky fish with mottled coloration which occurs widely in warm seas
